query: are relativity and determinism compatible
answer_text: While this response has a powerful intuitive grip (as can be seen from much of the popular and even scientific discussion of time travel), it is generally agreed, by philosophers, that the fatalist is making supposition. Different diagnoses have been given ofthe “fatalist fallacy” or other mistake in modal reasoning, but the basic point is simple. Truth is not the same as necessity; it doesn’t the Same as logical necessity, metaphysical necessity , or even the relative necessity of unavoidability or lack of ability or power. The existence of an elaborated set of truths about my future actions is consistent with my ability to do things other than the things I actually do. It is of course possible to agree thattheexistenceoftruthsaboutallourfutureactionsiscompatiblewithfreewill while denying thatthere exists ofnomologicallydeterminedtruthesaroundall ourfualaction actionsiscompatible withfree will. But an argument is needed for this conclusion,an argument which doesn't rely on fatalist reasoning or an appeal to fatalist intuitions. For comparisons between arguments for incompatribilism and argument for fatalism, see van Inwagen 1983, Mackie 2003, Perry 2004, and Vihvelin 2008 and 2013. in which two or more things are able to exist or perform together in combination without problems

In 1786 two Frenchmen became the first to Reach the Top of Mt. Blanc, Europe’s highest peak. Environmental problems In the past two centuries many changes have taken place in the alpene region. Increased industrialisation and tourism have led to air and water pollution, slope erosion and the destruction of forests. increased trade between European Union countries has lead to growing road traffic. It is one the big aims of European union to get more traffic onto railroads in order to reduce pollution and make the Alps  able to live and relax. query: are cities required to consider growth
answer_text: Within one year of July 1, 1990, each county that as of June 1, 1991, was required or chose to plan under RCW 36.70A.040, shall begin consulting with each city located within its boundaries and each country shall propose the location of an urban growth area. Within sixty days of the date the county legislative authority of a county adopts its resolution of intention or of certification by the office of financial management, all other counties that are required nor choose to Plan under RCW 36,70AA.044, shall commence this consultation with every city within it's boundaries. The county shall attempt to reach agreement with all city on the locations of urban development areas within which the city is located. If such an agreement is not reached with any city, the department shall try to resolve the conflicts, including the use of mediation services. An urban grow area may include more than  solitary city. Anurban growth may also include territory that is situated outside of city only if such territory already is characterized by urban expansion whether or not the urban area includes r oty, or is adjacent to territorial already categorized by urbain growth,or is designated new fully contained community as defined by RW36, 70A,350. (2) Based upon the growth management population projection made for the country by financial administration,the county and every county within the County shall include areas and densities sufficient to permit the rural growth that will occur
